definition: to scatter/to break sth up/to beat (an egg)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

sentences.english: And he answered me, These are the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 他回答說，這是打散猶大，以色列，和耶路撒冷的角。

sentences.english: In another shallow bowl, whisk the eggs, buttermilk and hot pepper sauce.
sentences.chinese: 在另一淺碗中，打散蛋，混合牛奶與辣椒醬。

sentences.english: Fold in the beaten whites of two eggs.
sentences.chinese: 加進兩個打散的蛋清後攪勻。

sentences.english: This broke up the agglomerates and some of the larger particles and coated them all with fat.
sentences.chinese: 這就把團塊和大顆粒打散，並且完全裹上脂肪。

sentences.english: Despite thinking the skin would be too thick, it's surprising how much light scatters inside.
sentences.chinese: 儘管思想的皮膚會太粗，它的光打散內多少驚訝。

sentences.english: Toast dip with beat eggs and then milks.
sentences.chinese: 土司沾上打散的蛋液及牛奶。

sentences.english: Next, fold in the beaten egg.
The armies were split up, there was no unity, no supreme command: Barclay was unpopular.
sentences.chinese: 軍隊被打散後，既沒有統一的指揮，巴克萊又孚衆望。

sentences.english: In order to understand this new term, let’s break it apart.
sentences.chinese: 要理解這個新的詞彙，不妨把它打散了來看。

sentences.english: The wind scattered the ships sank into the sea, dandelion.
sentences.chinese: 巨浪把風之帆船打散了，蒲公英沉入了海中。

sentences.english: As soon as the oil became hot, she poured the egg into the pan, As one side turned yellow, she turned it over.
sentences.chinese: 當油一熱，她立刻把打散的雞蛋倒入鍋內。

sentences.english: Break the yolk, add 2 tbsp water, mix well.
sentences.chinese: 將剩餘的一個蛋黃打散，加入2大勺清水，攪拌均勻。

definition: to shatter/to smash/to break into pieces
to draw to oneself/to gather up/to collect/to fold up (an umbrella, wings etc)/to assemble (a party of persons)/to rope in (some people)
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
